intro: Phippsia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of a single species, Phippsia hirta, which is native to the southern United States and Mexico. The plant is characterized by its small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in late summer. It is an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The botanical interest in Phippsia lies in its unique floral structure and its role in pollination by specific insect species.
